text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly discusses the doctrine of separability (also known as the autonomy of the arbitration clause) in Section II.B, citing both US precedent (Buckeye Check Cashing) and French law (Gosset/Article 1447 CPC) to support the argument that challenges to the main contract do not invalidate the arbitration clause.", "criterion_id": "35536524-cce3-4fcd-b96e-c553e851b879"}
